text: Your Friday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘The Daily’The host, Michael Barbaro, and the Daily team picked 10 powerful shows from this year.
The Modern Love PodcastA hard-earned holiday lesson about desire.

Justices Delay Ruling on Trump Plan for Unauthorized Immigrants and CensusThe Supreme Court dismissed a suit challenging efforts to exclude unauthorized immigrants from how House seats are allocated, saying it was premature.

Trump’s Future: Tons of Cash and Plenty of Options for Spending ItPresident Trump will have a pile of cash to fuel his future ambitions. He can hold rallies, hire staff and even prepare for a potential 2024 run.
Lara Trump served on the board of a company through which the Trump political operation spent more than $700 million.

New York City Will Change Many Selective Schools to Address SegregationThe pandemic prompted Mayor Bill de Blasio’s most significant action yet on integration: a major shift in how hundreds of schools admit students.

An Unprepared N.Y.P.D. Badly Mishandled Floyd Protests, Watchdog SaysAn oversight agency said that some officers used tactics that violated demonstrators’ First Amendment rights at protests following George Floyd’s death.

How New Yorkers Want to Change the Streetscape for GoodWhen the pandemic lockdown cleared roads, communities caught a glimpse of what it’s like when streets are reimagined. They don’t want to look back.
A Record-Breaking Week for the Virus, by the NumbersIt has been a discouraging week in the U.S., which saw record numbers in deaths and new cases. Here’s a look at what happened.
A death on a United Airlines flight raised concerns about possible coronavirus exposure.
A pharmacist preparing a dose of the Pfizer vaccine for the coronavirus on Wednesday. Michael A. McCoy for The New York Times

A Riveting ISIS Story, Told in a Times Podcast, Falls ApartA Canadian’s gruesome account as an Islamic State executioner in Syria, which was the subject of the “Caliphate” podcast, was fabricated, officials say.

New York Times Says ‘Caliphate’ Podcast Fell Short of StandardsThe Times cited an institutional failure and determined the “Caliphate” team gave too much credence to the claims of a supposed former terrorist.
A sheriff places a notice to quit, the first stage in an eviction process, in the door of an apartment in Springfield, Mass. Bryan Anselm for The New York Times
